questions.text: What was the average price of a gallon of gas in 1955?
questions.explanation: Gas was cheap! Around 23 cents per gallon (approx $2.50 adjusted).

questions.text: By 1975, the average price of gas had risen to:
questions.explanation: After the 1973 oil crisis, prices jumped to around 57 cents.

questions.text: How much was a first-class stamp in 1955?
questions.explanation: It cost just 3 cents to mail a letter.

questions.text: What was the average cost of a new house in 1955?
questions.explanation: The average new home cost about $10,950 (approx $120k today).

questions.text: In 1975, the average new house price had climbed to:
questions.explanation: Inflation pushed the average price to nearly $40,000.

questions.text: How much was a movie ticket in 1955?
questions.explanation: Going to the pictures cost less than 50 cents.

questions.text: What was the Federal Minimum Wage in 1955?
questions.explanation: It was raised to $1.00 in 1956, but in 1955 it was $0.75.

questions.text: How much was a gallon of milk in 1955?
questions.explanation: Milk was slightly under a dollar, around 97 cents.

questions.text: What was the base price of a 1965 Ford Mustang?
questions.explanation: The Mustang was marketed as an affordable sporty car, starting at $2,368.

questions.text: In 1975, a new Ford Granada cost approximately:
questions.explanation: Mid-70s inflation meant cars were getting pricier, around $3,700-$4,000 base.

questions.text: How much was a McDonald's hamburger in 1955?
questions.explanation: Ray Kroc's first McDonald's sold burgers for 15 cents.

questions.text: What was the average annual income in 1955?
questions.explanation: Families earned just over $4,000 a year on average.

questions.text: A loaf of bread in the 1950s cost about:
questions.explanation: Daily staples were very cheap, around 18 cents.

questions.text: How much did a color TV cost in the mid-1960s?
questions.explanation: Color TVs were luxury items, costing around $400-$500 (equivalent to $4000+ today).

questions.text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average hit what milestone in 1972?
questions.explanation: The Dow closed above 1,000 for the first time in November 1972.
